intro: Castilleja pterocaulon, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and relies on host plants for some of its nutritional needs. The plant has slender, often branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or red, arranged in clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
